content.description: Punk Rock Mohawk's sister route. Fun route with multiple short lived cruxes.
content.location: To the left of Punk Rock Mohawk. Shares anchors with Punk Rock Mohawk.

content.description: Start by climbing onto a ledge that is separated from the main cliff.  Follow the bolts up on good holds to the high crux where the holds diminish and the wall turns blank.  You can traverse left to avoid the seemingly blank face and make your way up the top edge and finally the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus a bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Use the Southern Approach and head straight out of the corridor where you will walk into an arête.  This route is the 2nd route on the face as you continue walking North.  The route begins on an obvious ledge that tapers off into the ground at the base of this route.

content.description: Quality route, best of the grade in Fern. Stickclip the first bolt. Its about 20 ft up. Climb the awesome arete and avoid the left side. The crux is just before the end. Step right after the crux and finish with some sustained overhanging climbing. If you stick to the left side, it will drop the route to a 12a.
content.location: The left side of the obvious bulge.

content.description: climb a series of 3 easy ledges, till you reach an interesting top 10' of face climbing.
content.location: left around the corner from punk rock mohawk

content.description: Probably the best route at Fern. Start just a little right of the first bolt climb up to the ledge for a rest. Hard moves off the ledge lead to a short but steep headwall below the anchors. Make sure your belayer is awake durning the crux to make sure you don't fall of the ledge.
Climb the broken dihedral and arete to the top. There are no anchors and good gear, but some of the blocks are loose.
content.location: Farthest left route on the wall.

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt and climb over the low roof onto an arete that overhangs near the top.
Climb a series of ledges to gain a crux up top

Start up some easy ledges left of the arête that lull you into a false sense of security.  You get to a good rest about half way up and then you start technical climbing using the arête to get to the crux just below the chains.  Taller climbers can clip the chains without having to do the crux.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus bolted anchors with chains.
content.location: The route is just left of the arête on the far right side of the Reservation Wall.  Use the Standard Approach and keep heading straight out of the corridor to walk directly into the arête where this route is located.

content.description: Starts on the right side of the Arete and climbs up to a small roof.  Move slightly right to better holds to get over the roof and find a huge horn waiting for you just above the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Take the South approach and keep walking straight out of the corridor and you will walk into this route.  It is just right of Smoke Signals.

content.description: This is a good 5.10, worthy of a few stars. I don't like it, however, because you have to clip the chains from some desperate slopers.
content.location: Left of the massive tree leaning against Reservation Wall. Right of the obvious Reservation Crack.

content.description: Obvious crack up the middle of the wall
content.protection:
Rack up to a #4 Camalot 

  Tree Anchor
content.location: Obvious crack in the middle of the wall. Inline with the farther pine tree.

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt and pull through a small roof on good holds. Work your way up ledges to another crux which then gives way to easier climbing to the anchors
content.location: On the face to the left of Teepee. Route is on the right side.

content.description: There is no defined crux, just sustained 5.10 climbing. The route wanders a bit between the bolts. One of the flakes felt a little hollow. Be careful.
content.location: Find the massive tree growing close to the rock of Reservation Wall. This is the route just to the right of the tree.

content.description: One of the best routes at Fern.  Slap up the left side of the arete to a bomber knee bar. Pull left through the crux and finish on juggy goodness

Easy climbing on ledges, side pulls, and some hidden jugs. Feels a little like a scramble in places and would be a good climb for new leaders. Watch out for a hollow/loose rock between the last bolt and anchors.
content.location: Take the standard approach through the corridor to the Reservation Wall and continue all the way to the end of the wall. The climb is on the "sunken" part of the wall between Battle Cry (12a) and Teepee (5.7T).

content.description: Superb rock quality and long routes for the area, this is the best wall at Fern by far.
